Articles.Content: Does anyone know anything aboiut the UIButton class? It is a return try from certain methods (EditorVesselOverlays.ToggleCoMbtn or EditorLogic.actionPanelBtn) for example, but is not defined in refferences. What do I need to be to be able to use it?

It is defined in Assembly-CSharp-firstpass.dll. Guess it will work once you add that dll to your references.

I'm not really into unity, so no idea why they have two separate dlls or what effects using both could have. Other than that it looks like just an average button class.
Thanks. I had found it eventually. How can I simulate it being pressed? I have tried a fre things, but have had no luck.

I believe all of the UI components are based on EZ GUI. The reference for UIButton is here: http://www.anbsoft.com/middleware/ezgui/docs/scripting/class_u_i_button.html

Looks like you could try calling the OnInput method.

Oh they're using ezgui?

Can we use it in plugins or is only unity gui allowed?

Can't give an official answer, but i can't see how it should break any plugin rules. You don't have to distribute source code, since you do not include any external stuff but only use some classes from game libraries.
